Package gui

Class managerScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.managerScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class managerScreen
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The class represents the manager side of the interface for the boba point of sale system. This class allows for managers to generate reports on the store's profit and sales, view and analyze ordering trends, and update the inventory and employee databases. This interface connects to the storeâ€™s PostgreSQL database to update the inventory and employee information as the manager makes changes, and it also gathers data from all of the tables in the database for the manager to view and analyze. The manager is able to generate X Reports, Z Reports, and general reports over any time period. Additionally, they can view ordering trends as a list or as a chart.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private class  managerScreen.EmployeesPanel
      This class creates and handles anything relating to employees, which includes accessing the list of employees from the database, editing the list to add or remove employees, and displaying the list on the employee page.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      managerScreen()
      This constructor initializes the manager screen interface by calling the managerGUI method, which displays the opening page of the manager's view and allows the manager to choose between four different pages: "Generate Reports", "Ordering Trends", "Inventory", and "Employees".

    • Constructor Detail

      • managerScreen

        public managerScreen()
        This constructor initializes the manager screen interface by calling the managerGUI method, which displays the opening page of the manager's view and allows the manager to choose between four different pages: "Generate Reports", "Ordering Trends", "Inventory", and "Employees".

    • Method Detail

      • reportConnection

        private void reportConnection()
        Retrieves and displays data on the store's sales history records with the specified date and time range. It validates the date/time inputs, constructs a SQL query to fetch order IDs, timestamps, and prices from the database, and formats it into a report. It also handles special cases like generating a peak sales day summary of the sum of the top ten most expensive orders on a certain day when only a specific date is provided.

      • runPeakSalesDay

        private void runPeakSalesDay​(java.time.LocalDate day)
        Generates a detailed report for a single day by calculating the sum of the top ten most expensive orders of a specific day when only a single date is provided in the input fields for generating a report. This method queries the database for all orders taken on the specific day and then performs another SQL query to find the sum.
        Parameters:
        day - the day to find the total of the ten most expensive orders for

      • generateReport

        private javax.swing.JPanel generateReport()
        Constructs and returns the "Generate Report" page used in the manager interface. It builds a structured JPanel layout with input fields for the desired date and time, buttons for generating either X, Z, or general reports, and a scrollable text area to view the report itself.
        Returns:
        a fully assembled JPanel for the "Generate Report" interface

      • fillXReport

        private void fillXReport()
        Generates and displays the X Report, which summarizes the sales performance by hour for the current day. This method queries the database and computes hourly totals for profit, the number of orders, and the number of drinks sold, and then populates the results into a table.

      • fillZReport

        private void fillZReport()
        Generates and displays the end-of-fay Z Report, which includes the total sales, tax, order counts, employee order totals, and other sales details. It queries the database for the current day's orders, calculates the data and formats the results into the report text area. It then resets the inventory usage counters to prepare for the next business day.

      • ordersPerEmployeeQuery

        public java.lang.String ordersPerEmployeeQuery​(int employeeID)
        Builds a SQL query that counts how many orders a specific employee processed during the current day. This query is used within the Z Report to calculate each employee's total number of completed orders for the current day.
        Parameters:
        employeeID - the ID of the employee whose order count will be calculated
        Returns:
        a SQL query string that counts the employee's daily orders

      • resetQuantityUsedQuery

        public java.lang.String resetQuantityUsedQuery​(int itemID)
        Builds a SQL query that resets the usage counter for a specific inventory item. This is used during the Z Report to mark all items as fully restocked by setting their quantityUsed field back to zero for the next business day.
        Parameters:
        itemID - The ID of the item to be reset
        Returns:
        A SQL query string that update's the inventory item's quantityUsed variable.

      • trendsConnection

        private void trendsConnection()
        Retrieves and visualizes current inventory usage trends by querying the database. This method connects specifically to the inventory table, gathers item usage information, and displays that information both as a text report and as a chart of the most frequently used items. This method excludes seasonal items.

      • seasonalTrendsConnection

        private void seasonalTrendsConnection()
        Retrieves and visualizes sales trends for all inventory items, including seasonal items. This method connects specifically to the inventory table, gathers item usage information, and displays that information both as a text report and as a chart of the most frequently used items. This method orders all items across the database, including both regular menu items and seasonal flavors.

      • orderingTrends

        private javax.swing.JPanel orderingTrends()
        Constructs and returns the "Ordering Trends" page for the manager interface. This method builds a split layout that includes both a bar chart and a text report. The bar chart includes a toggle buttom to switch between only regular and both regular and seasonal items, with the text report also updating accordingly. It initializes the chart area, styles and components, and loads the trends data.
        Returns:
        a fully assembled JPanel for the "Ordering Trends" interface

      • inventoryConnection

        private void inventoryConnection()
        Retrieves and displays the complete inventory data from the database in a text view. This method queries the inventory table for all its items with their quantities, sales prices, and reorder prices. It then formats the data into a structured report.

      • addInventory

        private void addInventory()
        Inserts a new inventory item into the database using the values provided in the input fields. This method validates the user input and ensures all fields have been filled, opens a databse connection, and inserts the item into the inventory table. After successfully adding the item, it refreshes the on-screen inventory list, ensuring that the new item is immediately reflected in the manager interface.

      • generateDrinkCombinationsForItem

        private void generateDrinkCombinationsForItem​(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                              int itemId)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Generate all drink combinations that include the specified inventory item, and then it inserts any missing combinations into the drinks table of the database while avoiding duplicated. It then calculates the price of the new drink before inserting it into the database.
        Parameters:
        conn - uses existing connection to inventory database to create possible drinks
        itemId - the item ID for which to generate the combinations
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs while makeing the connection

      • insertDrink

        private boolean insertDrink​(java.sql.PreparedStatement checkStmt,
                            java.sql.PreparedStatement insertStmt,
                            java.sql.PreparedStatement priceStmt,
                            int drinkID,
                            int teaID,
                            int flavorID,
                            int toppingID,
                            double sugar,
                            double ice)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts a new drink combination into the database if that combination does not already exist. This method checks for duplicates, computes the price of the new drink, and performs the insertion when needed.
        Parameters:
        checkStmt - determines if the specific drink combination already exists
        insertStmt - inserts the drink into the database
        priceStmt - computes price for drink by summing up the tea, flavor, and topping prices
        drinkID - adds drinkID to drinks table
        teaID - sets tea for specific drink combo
        flavorID - sets flavor for specific drink combo
        toppingID - sets topping for specific drink combo
        sugar - sets sugar level for specific drink combo
        ice - sets ice level for specific drink combo
        Returns:
        a boolean representing if the drink was successfully inserted into the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - ensures all fields have an input when adding a drink

      • deleteInventory

        private void deleteInventory()
        Deletes an inventory item identified by the entered ID or name. The method performs an SQL statement and then reports the number of rows deleted. Once deleted, the on-screen view of the inventory list refreshes to reflect the changes.

      • inventoryPage

        private javax.swing.JPanel inventoryPage()
        Sets up the design for the manager's inventory page, which displays the inventory table from the database and has the option to add or delete inventory items. The inventory display area is populated in inventoryConnection().
        Returns:
        the designed inventory page as a JPanel

      • managerGUI

        private void managerGUI()
        Sets up the main manager page, which includes the constant header and footer, along with the four buttons displaying the available pages to look at. Upon choosing a button, the corresponding page will be generated and displayed.

      • showPage

        private void showPage​(javax.swing.JPanel page)
        Displays the given page and removes anything currently visible.
        Parameters:
        page - the page to make visible

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Sets the look and feel; generated by NetBeans.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments
